Billy Ko, President - Investment Club at Singapore Institute Of TechnologyLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Jun 2019Hi! You might want to check out this article which shows the various promotions for each credit card.
https://blog.moneysmart.sg/transportation/transitlink-simplygo-abt/GIven how uni students pay the same fare as adults (if not concession is purchased) I would probably turn to using these credit cards to earn their cashbacks / rewards during the promotion period.
But ultimately, a $5 cashback equates to only approx 3 rides, therefore, it all boils down to your transport expenditure. If you were to not purchase concession and switch to SimplyGo instead, just make sure that the opportunity cost is a positive one (cashback earned  additional amount paid for not purchasing concession)0 comments0
